title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: 112 drug samples fail quality tests in September, 1 found spurious: Govt
Maharashtra's Mihan SEZ welcomes Solar Defence and Aerospace Ltd with major drone manufacturing investment
Japan factory PMI hits 19-month low in Oct
items.summary:
- *Japan’s factory PMI* fell to 48.3 in October, the lowest since March 2024, signaling a 19-month contraction.
- *New orders* declined faster, while export orders fell, though October’s export drop was the slowest since March and exports rose in September.
- *Services and composite PMIs* showed a mixed picture (services 52.4, composite 50.9) with rising cost pressures across inputs and outputs.

items.title: LONGi to source ₹7,000cr modules from Inox Solar
items.author: Shilpa Samant, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- **LONGi** will source 5 GW of solar modules from *Inox Solar* for the Indian market under a ₹7,000 crore deal over three years. 
- *Inox Solar* is expanding capacity with a Bavla plant of 1.2 GW (to 3 GW) and a 4.8 GW cell/module facility in Dhenkanal, with an IPO planned for Inox Clean Energy. 
- The arrangement supports domestic content and India’s growing module/cell capacity amid import duties.

items.title: GST reduces on notebooks but expect no relief on prices
Defence Ministry nod for ₹79,000 crore hardware buy
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- **₹79,000 crore** defence package approved for Army, Navy and Air Force.
- Army: NAMIS, GBMES and High Mobility Vehicles to boost logistics.
- Navy & Air Force: LPDs, NSG, ALWT, EO/IRST and smart ammo; AoN for *CLRTS/DS* enabling autonomous ops.

items.title: Govt launches training modules for effective management of chemical emergencies
Cochin Shipyard delivers Mahe to Indian Navy
items.summary:
- *Cochin Shipyard Limited* delivered *Mahe*, the first in a series of eight *ASW SWC* vessels, to the *Indian Navy*, underscoring India's push for *self-reliant* defence manufacturing.
- The 78‑metre craft uses a diesel‑engine–waterjet propulsion system to boost speed, agility and shallow‑water capabilities for roles such as underwater surveillance and search & rescue.
- With **over 90% indigenous content**, the project exemplifies the government’s *Make in India* drive, and the remaining seven ships in the series are under construction for phased delivery.

items.title: From $250 million to $2 billion: India’s role in global aerospace supply chain grows
Premier Energies buys 51% stake in Transcon
items.summary:
- *Premier Energies* is expanding into transformer manufacturing by acquiring a 51% stake in *Transcon Industries* for ₹500.3 crore.
- This move aims to build a fully integrated *clean energy solutions provider*, serving renewable power, DISCOMs and industrial customers with higher-value transformers.
- The deal broadens *downstream integration* into transformers, solar/storage/inverters, strengthening the energy value chain in India.

items.title: ISRO to launch 6.5-tonne US BlueBird-6 satellite before year-end, says Dr V. Narayanan
Bondada secures ₹1,050 cr for 650 MW Khavda project
items.summary:
- Bondada Engineering Limited has secured a **₹1,050 crore LOI** from *Adani Green Energy Limited* for a 650 MW solar project at *Khavda Renewable Energy Park*, Gujarat.
- The LOI covers the **BOS** goods, including *design*, *engineering*, *manufacturing*, *procurement*, *quality assurance*, packing, and site delivery.
- **Khavda Renewable Energy Park** is a *30 GW* project spanning 538 sq km in Gujarat, touted as the world's largest power plant by area.

items.title: UK manufacturers see weakest outlook for orders since 2020
items.author: Reuters
items.summary: - *CBI* says orders weakest since 2020 as current orders hit their lowest since December, with energy costs and tax worries ahead of the Budget.\n- *CBI* index sank to -38 in October, below long-run -14; domestic and export orders fell sharply, export orders outlook worst since April 2020.\n- Manufacturers urge government action to cut energy bills; Budget on Nov 26 could bring ~£25 billion of tax rises or spending cuts, affecting hiring/investment.

items.title: Airbus, Leonardo and Thales to merge space activities into €6.5 billion company
Lam Research eyes upbeat quarterly revenue
items.summary:
- Lam Research forecast Q2 revenue around *$5.20B* (+/-$0.30B), topping estimates amid **robust AI demand** for chipmaking tools.
- Shares rose ~2.2% after hours as demand for *AI semiconductors* and **wafer fabrication equipment** stayed strong.
- In the prior quarter, Lam posted **$5.32B** revenue and EPS of **$1.26**, beating estimates of $1.22.

items.title: US to announce plutonium recipients for reactors by year-end
items.summary:
- The *U.S. Energy Department* plans to announce by December 31 which firms will take about 19.7 metric tons of surplus plutonium for reactor fuel.
- Applications are due by November 21, with selections by year-end; the plan would offer *weapons-grade plutonium* as fuel, drawing concerns from *nuclear safety experts* about proliferation.
- Oklo and Newcleo are among firms pursuing fuel‑facility plans, despite MOX history and safety concerns.

items.title: US weighs export curbs on China-bound goods
items.summary: - The *Trump administration* is weighing broad export controls on China-bound products that contain or are produced with *US software*, from laptops to jet engines, in response to Beijing's rare earth limits. - The plan could be announced to pressure China but may stop short of full implementation, reflecting a debate among officials about the path forward. - If enacted, the policy would echo steps the *Biden administration* took against Russia and could reshape global tech trade, with potential costs for the US economy.

items.title: Hindalco’s AluChem buyout delayed by US shutdown
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - *CFIUS* review of Hindalco’s planned acquisition of *AluChem* has been delayed due to the *US federal government shutdown*. - Hindalco had submitted a short-form declaration and later a long-form declaration; with deadlines tolled, the review could take up to about *105 days* after normal operations resume. - The deal is to be executed through *Aditya Holdings LLC*, signaling a strategic push into *specialty alumina* and Hindalco’s high‑value materials portfolio.

items.title: Allcargo Group appoints Punit Misra as President – Chairman Office and CBO
India’s generics industry gets clarity after key court verdict
STMicroelectronics sees Q4 sales momentum
items.summary:
- STMicroelectronics expects Q4 sales to reach about **$3.28 billion**, up from **$3.19 billion** this quarter, signaling a sustained recovery.
- Analysts polled by **LSEG** expect Q4 revenue around **$3.34 billion**, higher than the third quarter's **$3.12 billion**.
- The company reiterates strategic priorities like **innovation** and reshaping its manufacturing footprint amid ongoing headwinds in automotive and consumer chip markets.

items.title: HUL Q2 net profit up 4% to ₹2,694 cr on one-off tax gain
items.summary:
- Hindustan Unilever's Q2 net profit rose 4% to ₹2,694 crore, aided by a **one-off tax resolution** between UK and Indian authorities.
- Revenue rose 2% YoY to ₹16,241 crore as **GST changes** and an extended **monsoon** disrupted channels, with **EBITDA margin** slipping 90 bps to 23.2%.
- CEO Priya Nair called it a **competitive performance**, outlining portfolio transformation, sharper segmentation, and deeper digital integration to sustain volume-led growth, with normal trading conditions expected by early November.

items.title: Falling production from KG-D6 drags down national gas output
items.author: Sanjeev Choudhary, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- KG-D6 gas production fell 8% YoY in H1, dragging India's total gas output down about *3%* to *17,585 mmscm*. 
- Private-sector gas output dropped *5.5%* to *6,776 mmscm*, while ONGC fell *2%* and Oil India rose *1%*, contributing to the decline. 
- Domestic consumption weakened *7%*, LNG imports fell *11%*, and India aims to raise gas share to *15% by 2030*.

items.title: Vikram Solar bags 148.9 MW module order from Sunsure
items.summary:
- **Vikram Solar** bags 148.9 MW of *M10R N-Type TOPCon* modules for Sunsure Energy, to be deployed in *Maharashtra* and *Uttar Pradesh*. 
- Delivery is poised within 60 days from the NTP, with expected completion by *January 2026*. 
- The deal adds to Vikram Solar's recent wins and underscores a strategic partnership with Sunsure Energy, backed by *Partners Group AG*, to expand India's solar capacity.

items.title: Supply chain, e-waste issues can hit critical mineral plan
items.author: Suryash Kumar, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The ₹1,500 crore incentive plan aims to boost *critical minerals* recycling and process about half of the country’s *black mass* domestically in 2–3 years, but the ₹50 crore beneficiary cap could blunt impact.
- The success hinges on streamlining *e-waste collection* and a resilient *supply chain*, since much of the metals are still exported.
- Experts say rapid access to the right *technology* and a trained *skilled workforce* is essential to build a lasting domestic *critical minerals* ecosystem for lithium, nickel and cobalt.

items.title: Developing nations must unite on trade issues: Piyush Goyal
items.summary:
- **Goyal urged the Global South to speak with one voice on trade challenges, including tariffs and other barriers.**
- **He warned about unilateral environmental rules and supply-chain bottlenecks that hit developing nations hardest.**
- **He called for digital public infrastructure and reforms in minerals, fertilizers and services to boost growth and poverty reduction.**

items.title: Google says its Willow chip achieved first-ever "verifiable quantum advantage"
Ducol Organics & Colours to strengthen metro footprint before expanding to tier-2 and tier-3 markets: MD Aamer Ahmed Farid
India emerges as key growth market for Nestlé and Reckitt
items.author: Ratna Bhushan, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Nestlé India reported its highest-ever quarterly sales, up 10.8% YoY to ₹5,411 crore, signaling strong *momentum* in a GST-reformed *India*. 
- Reckitt Benckiser called *India* a standout market, with emerging markets delivering double-digit growth despite GST changes, and *India* contributing to the quarter’s performance. 
- Both firms frame *India* as a key growth engine in their emerging markets, forecasting sustained expansion amid near-term disruptions.

items.title: Chinese phone makers expand India presence despite thin margins
Indian Army signs ₹2,700 cr deal for 4.25 lakh carbines
items.summary:
- The Indian Army signed a ₹2,700 crore deal to buy 4.25 lakh close-quarter carbines, with **Bharat Forge** supplying 2.5 lakh and the rest from **PLR Systems**. 
- The carbines fire **5.56 mm** rounds and are intended to replace older rifles, boosting infantry capability in operations. 
- Deliveries start next year, with the weapons forecast to be in service for *20-30 years*.

items.title: Diversify rare earths supply to curb China grip, Mukherjee
items.summary:
- *China* dominates rare earth processing, and Neha Mukherjee warns the world is structurally dependent, urging diversification to secure the *supply chain*. 
- Export controls on heavy and medium rare earths threaten defence, e-mobility, and electronics, as about **95%** of these materials come from China. 
- India is pursuing diversification through imports, domestic mining, and partnerships, with the government earmarking funds to **boost domestic magnet production**.

items.title: New training centre of Butibori Manufacturers Association to be ready soon
Indian fertiliser firms to set up urea plant in Russia
items.author: Shambhavi Anand, ET Bureau
items.summary: - **RCF**, **NFL**, and **IPL** are planning to establish India's first overseas *urea* plant in **Russia** under an NDA with Russian firms to begin work on land, gas pricing, and logistics.\n- The plant is expected to produce over 2 million tonnes of *urea* annually and will seek steady supplies of natural gas and ammonia while reducing exposure to volatile global prices.\n- The venture could be announced during President Putin's December visit, marking a long-term strategic fertilizer tie between India and Russia.

items.title: Trump eyes fresh tariff probe focused on foreign drug prices
Army undergoing a high-tech upgrade for next-gen battles
items.summary:
- The Indian Army is modernizing 382 infantry battalions to counter tech-driven warfare, inducting **sniper rifles**, **rocket-launchers**, **loitering munitions**, night sights and other advanced gear.
- It is deploying nine drone types for ISR and suicide missions, raising *Ashni* drone platoons and **Bhairav** commando units to boost battlefield transparency and rapid strike.
- Key deals include ₹2,770 crore for 4.2 lakh carbines (60% Bharat Forge, rest PLR), plus **Javelin launchers** and missiles to bolster **ATGMs**, with rifles upgraded to **7.62 mm**.

items.title: India calls for closer South-South ties in critical minerals, fertilisers
Govt tightens oversight of edible oil with VOPPA order
items.summary:
- The government now requires all edible oil stakeholders to register under the *VOPPA Order, 2025* and submit monthly production and stock returns online.
- The amendment seeks greater regulatory oversight and real-time data to bolster India’s *food security* and *supply-chain resilience*.
- Non-compliance will be treated as a violation, with penalties and planned inspections to enforce registration and reporting.

items.title: Volkswagen warns workers of potential stoppages as chip crunch looms
VW prepares staff for temporary plant closures, Bild
items.summary:
- *VW* is preparing staff for potential temporary plant closures, per *Bild*, citing an internal management letter warning of disruptions. 
- The memo says current production hasn't yet been hit by *chip shortages* but warns disruptions could arise as the situation evolves. 
- VW said it would pause production of two key models but denied any link to the *Nexperia* supply-chain dispute.

items.title: TKSE due diligence deepens as Jindal bids
items.summary:
- *TKSE* due diligence to deepen next week as *Jindal Steel* gains greater access to financial details.
- *Jindal Steel* has made an indicative bid; pension liabilities (~€2.7B) pose a major hurdle.
- The plan includes over €2B for capacity expansion, including a direct reduction plant in *Duisburg* and more *electric arc furnaces*, aiming for carbon-neutral steel.

items.title: China probes US chipmakers for sensitive data
items.summary:
- *China's Trade Remedy and Investigation Bureau* has opened an anti-dumping probe into certain American *analog IC chips*, requesting sensitive sales data from U.S. chipmakers such as *Texas Instruments* and *Analog Devices*. 
- The questionnaires seek sales in China, names of Chinese customers, transaction details, and cost‑to‑profit comparisons, with a 37‑day window to respond. 
- The move follows US export controls and broader tech tensions, signaling reciprocal pressure even as Beijing emphasizes security concerns.

items.title: Coal Ministry widens indigenous tech in gasification
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- The Coal Ministry widened the definition of *indigenous technology* under its gasification financial-support scheme to include foreign-developed tech adapted in India with **significant innovation** and viability.
- It clarified that tech developed, owned, and substantially proven in India— including patents or IP— will be considered *indigenous*, and that technologies adapted via collaboration or technology transfer can qualify if they show **significant development** and independent commercialisation in Indian conditions.
- The changes allow category flexibility, CCUS integration in pilot/small-scale projects, and exempt underground coal gasification (UCG) from the proven indigenous technology requirement with a ₹100 crore minimum cap, while maintaining the 30% net-worth rule to accelerate investment in coal and lignite gasification.

items.title: Govt to hold Open House on steel import issues
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- The Ministry of Steel will hold an *Open House* on October 27 at Udyog Bhavan to discuss issues related to the *import of steel* in Delhi.
- The event runs 12:00 noon to 6:00 pm; only one representative per organisation and pre-registration by email are required, with time-slots confirmed by October 24.
- This follows pressure from cheaper imports—especially from *China*—and a 12% safeguard duty in April 2025 to shield *domestic producers* under the *Make in India* initiative.

items.title: Tobacco Board sets Nov 30 deadline for 2026 renewal
items.summary:
- The Tobacco Board has directed manufacturers, exporters, processors, dealers and packers to register or renew for 2026, with *November 1* for fresh registrations and *November 30* for renewals, all submitted online via the Board's portal.
- E-filing is mandatory and applicants must upload self-certified copies of documents along with statutory returns under the *Tobacco Board Rules, 1976*.
- Violations such as licensing or trading without a valid licence will invite action under the *Tobacco Board Act, 1975*, with all applications required to be filed on the official online system.

items.title: India shifts renewables from speed to system strength
items.summary: - *Dispatchable* grid, storage, and market reforms underpin India's shift from rapid capacity additions to a stronger, integrated system. - India aims for **500 GW** of non-fossil capacity by 2030, anchored by grid integration and transmission expansion. - Despite a recalibration, annual additions remain high (15–25 GW), with ~40 GW nearing PPAs and a ₹2.4 lakh crore Transmission Plan unlocking over 200 GW.

items.title: NMDC cuts iron ore lump and fines rates
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- NMDC cuts iron ore lump by *₹550/tonne* and fines by *₹500/tonne*, setting lump at ₹5,550 and fines at ₹4,750 per tonne, effective immediately.
- The revision follows no change for two months, signaling pressure in the domestic *steel market*.
- Iron ore prices influence steel costs across *construction*, *infrastructure*, *automobile*, and *railways*.

items.title: Heineken India's volume slips on unusual rains
items.summary:
- Heineken India's beer volume declined by *mid-single-digit* in the Sep quarter due to unusually heavy *monsoon rains*. 
- Organic net revenue grew by a *mid-single-digit*, helped by *price hikes* in key states and portfolio mix. 
- Premium beer volume grew in the *low teens*, led by Ultra Max and Amstel Grande, despite overall volume headwinds.

items.title: Superhealth signs ₹2,500-cr radiology pact
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- *Superhealth* inked a multi-year deal worth over ₹2,500 crore with *United Imaging Healthcare* for advanced radiology systems across 100 upcoming hospitals. 
- Under the pact, United Imaging will supply, install, and lifecycle-manage a suite including *AI-ready MRI*, 160-slice CT, full-body *cardiac CT*, digital mammography and X-ray, plus a dedicated India service hub and parts depot, creating over 1,000 high-skill jobs. 
- The 100-hospital pipeline aims to generate about 50,000 healthcare jobs by 2030, boosting access to world-class imaging in India.

items.title: DGCA approves AVPL International’s Hisar drone training centre
items.summary:
- DGCA approved the Drone Remote Pilot Training Organisation (RPTO) of **AVPL International** in *Hisar*. 
- The RPTO includes **10 DGCA‑approved flying zones** to provide practical training in *drone operation* and maintenance. 
- Founder and MD *Preet Sandhu* says the initiative will equip India’s youth with *drone skills* and create employment, especially in rural areas.
